description: Let sigma_m (n) be result of applying sum-of-divisors function m times to n; call n (m,k)-perfect if sigma_m (n) = k*n; sequence gives the (2,10)-perfect numbers.
comments: See also the Cohen-te Reile links under A019276.No other terms < 5x10^11. - Jud McCranie, Feb 08 2012
links: G. L. Cohen and H. J. J. te Riele, Iterating the sum-of-divisors function, Experimental Mathematics, 5 (1996), pp. 93-100.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from _Jud McCranie_, Nov 13 2001; a(9) Jan 29 2012, a(10) Feb 08 2012
